page.title: 07St.Cuthberts Church
page.content: St. Cuthbert's Church was built around the year 883 for the first time. It was rebuilt around the year 1735. The only link with the gothic past is an old buttress. St. Cuthbert's Church is in the parish of North Meols.There is a lych gate at the front entrance where two stone gate-posts once were.The posts now stand between the Hesketh Arms public house and the parish hall.The contents of the Church are described in sequence, starting at the left of the main entrance and proceeding clock-wise.The small winding staircase in the south-west corner leads to the gallery and upper stages of the tower. Immediately to the right is the eighteenth century { {STONE FONT}with its original wooden cover.On either side are two chairs alloted to the Member of Parliament
